smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found. All 19 pages contain diagrams with at least one element (package diagram on page 1, use case diagrams on pages 2-3, activity diagram on page 4, class diagrams on pages 5-13, database diagrams on pages 14-19).

On page 2 (Autode funktsionaalne allsüsteem - Vaata & Tuvasta), all use case ovals (Tuvasta kasutaja, Vaata aktiivseid autosid, Vaata kõiki autosid, Vaata autode koondaruannet) are shown within the system boundary with actors (Uudistaja, Klienditeenindaja, Juhataja, Klient, Autode haldur) positioned to interact with them. On page 3, all use cases (Registreeri auto, Lõpeta auto, Muuda autot, etc.) have visible associations with Autode haldur and/or Juhataja actors.

No duplicate use case names describing the same activity with the same actor were found. Page 2 has unique use cases (Tuvasta kasutaja, Vaata aktiivseid autosid, Vaata kõiki autosid, Vaata autode koondaruannet). Page 3 has distinct use cases (Registreeri auto, Lõpeta auto, Muuda autot, Aktiveeri auto, Muuda auto mittaktiivseks, Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid, Unusta auto). All names describe different activities.

On page 1 (package diagram), all model elements within each package have unique names. Autode funktsionaalne allsüsteem, Isikute register, Klassifikaatorite register, Töötajate register, Autode register, and Klientide register each contain elements with distinct names within their respective packages.

Columns with identical names across tables (e.g., 'nimetus', 'on_aktiivne') represent different contextual data in their respective tables and are not redundant copies of the same data. All inter-table data relationships are properly connected via Foreign Keys (FK_ prefixes visible throughout pages 14-19).

All use cases follow consistent verb-first naming pattern. Page 2: Tuvasta kasutaja, Vaata aktiivseid autosid, Vaata kõiki autosid, Vaata autode koondaruannet. Page 3: Registreeri auto, Lõpeta auto, Muuda autot, Aktiveeri auto, Muuda auto mittaktiivseks, Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid, Unusta auto. All start with Estonian verbs (Tuvasta, Vaata, Registreeri, Lõpeta, Muuda, Aktiveeri, Unusta).

On page 9 (Auto seisundidiagramm), all 6 states are reachable: Algus is the initial state, Ootel receives transition from Algus, Aktiivne receives transitions from Ootel and Mitteaktiivne, Mitteaktiivne receives transition from Aktiivne, Lõpetatud receives transitions from Aktiivne and Mitteaktiivne, Unustatud receives transition from Ootel. Every state has at least one incoming transition path.

On page 4 (Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm), all actions are reachable from Algus (start node). The flow proceeds: Algus → Vaata kõiki autosid → decision nodes → Otsi autot / Vali auto → Lõpeta valitud auto → Lõpp, with all paths connected via control flow.

All relationships in class and database diagrams have multiplicity indicators on both ends. Examples: Page 5 shows '0..1', '0..*', '1'. Page 6 shows '1', '0..1', '0..*'. Pages 14-19 database diagrams show multiplicities like '0..*', '1', '0..1' on all FK relationships.

Counted central elements per diagram: Page 2: 4 use cases. Page 3: 7 use cases. Page 5: 3 classes (Isik, Töötaja, Auto). Page 6: 4 classes. Page 7: 6 classes. Page 8: 6 classes. Page 9: 6 states. Page 10: 5 classes. Page 11: 3 classes. Page 12: 7 classes. Page 13: 3 classes. Page 14: 4 tables. Page 15: 9 tables (Tootaja_roll, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Auto_kategooria_tyyp, Riik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, Auto_kytuse_liik, Kliendi_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark, Auto_kategooria). Page 16: 3 tables. Page 17: 6 tables. Page 18: 2 tables. Page 19: 5 tables. Maximum is 9 on page 15. Threshold is ≥10. Since 9 < 10, smell is NOT present.

Counted visual connection lines per element on each diagram. Maximum found: Page 12 - Auto has 4 visible connections (to Auto_kategooria_omamine, Auto_seisundi_liik, Auto_kütuse_liik, Auto_mark). Page 17 - Autod has 5 visible connections (to Auto_kytuse_liik, Auto_mark, Auto_seisundi_liik, Auto_kategooria_omamine, plus FK to Töötaja on page 18). Page 19 - Tootajad has 4 connections. Maximum is 5. Threshold is ≥6. Since 5 < 6, smell is NOT present.

Visual inspection of all diagrams shows related elements positioned within reasonable proximity. No relationships span distances that appear to exceed twice the average element distance on any diagram.

All use case and action names start with active verbs. Page 2-3 use cases: Tuvasta (Identify), Vaata (View), Registreeri (Register), Lõpeta (End), Muuda (Modify), Aktiveeri (Activate), Unusta (Forget). Page 4 actions: Vaata, Otsi (Search), Vali (Select), Lõpeta. All are active verb forms in Estonian.

All class, table, attribute, and use case names have 4 or more characters. Shortest names found: Auto (4 chars), Isik (4 chars), Riik (4 chars), kood (4 chars). Threshold is ≤3 characters. Since minimum found is 4, which is > 3, smell is NOT present.

All class names start with uppercase and are singular. Examples: Isik, Kasutajakonto, Töötaja, Klient, Auto, Klassifikaator, Riik, Auto_kategooria, Auto_mark, Auto_seisundi_liik. No lowercase starting letters or plural forms found in class diagrams (pages 5-13).

All attribute/column names start with lowercase. Examples from class diagrams: e_meil, eesnimi, elukoht, isikukood, perenimi, reg_aeg, nimetus, on_aktiivne, kood, mudel. Examples from database diagrams: isik_id, isikukood, riik_kood, synni_kp, auto_kood, nimetus. No uppercase starting letters found.

Multiple database table names are plural. Page 14: Isikud (plural of Isik), Kasutajakontod (plural of Kasutajakonto). Page 16: Kliendid (plural of Klient). Page 17-18: Autod (plural of Auto). Page 19: Tootajad (plural of Töötaja). At least 5 tables have plural names, violating the singular naming convention.

No type prefixes found in class, table, or attribute names. Prefixes like tbl_, uc_, str, int are absent. The PK_, FK_, pfK, and IXFK_ prefixes present in database diagrams are explicitly allowed per the rule definition and should be ignored.
